Issues.Title: Angular elements OnChanges/OnInit hooks call order error on init
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/elements


### Is this a regression?

dunno


### Description

Angular elements OnChanges and OnInit hooks are called in wrong order on init in regular angular component's template: OnInit fires first and has `undefined` in inputs.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-elements-onchanges-order?file=app%2Fapp.component.html
```
> parent OnInit, input value: undefined
> child OnInit, input value: undefined
> parent OnChanges, input value: 1
> child OnChanges, input value: 2
```
expected (like in regular components)
```
> parent OnChanges, input value: 1
> parent OnInit, input value: 1
> child OnChanges, input value: 2
> child OnInit, input value: 2
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
7.1.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular elements OnChanges/OnInit hooks call order error on init" (#28266)

Issues.Title: Child custom element's OnInit hook is called before parent's one
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/elements


### Is this a regression?

Dunno

### Description

Wrong OnInit hooks call order when custom elements (parent + child) are added with some delay after (regular) angular component inited.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-elements-init-order?file=app%2Fapp.component.html

1. on toggle
```
> child OnInit
> parent OnInit
```
2. same wrong order on replacing `*ngIf="visible"` with `*ngIf="true"`
3. same wrong order on uncommenting `window.setTimeout` with `innerHTML` usage in AppComponent's OnInit hook
4. correct order on removing `<ng-container *ngIf="visible">`
```
> parent OnInit
> child OnInit
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
7.1.4

**Anything else relevant?**

No such issue with native custom elements and `setTimeout` + `innerHTML` usage
https://stackblitz.com/edit/custom-elements-init-order?file=index.ts
```
> parent connected
> child connected
```

Real word use-case: adding unknown markup with custom elements from api response.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Child custom element's OnInit hook is called before parent's one" (#28265)

Issues.Title: fix(animations): implement getPosition in browser animation builder
Issues.Body:
## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
calling `player.getPosition` always returns 0
Issue Number: #23785 #18891 


## What is the new behavior?
calling `player.getPosition` will return the position of the animation that is complete, as a percent (decimal) value (this is to match the `setPosition` functionality although it does not match the docs). 

If `player.getPosition` is called on a player with a group of animations, the returned value will be the position of the longest animation (including delays)

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information
As mentioned above, the functionality does not match the documentation (which says get/set position is measured in milliseconds). I opted to have the functionality match `setPosition` for consistency.

I considered changing the documentation, but unfortunately, it is a interface implemented by `CssKeyframesPlayer`, which _does_ match the documentation. Let me know if I should either include the documentation change or the functionality.

I did not include tests because `AnimationGroupPlayer` does not have any tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(animations): implement getPosition in browser animation builder" (#28264)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): content projection with Shadow DOM not working
Issues.Body:
Fixes components with native content projection (using `<content>` or `<slot>`) not working under Ivy.

The issue comes from the fact that when creating elements inside a component, we sometimes don't append the element immediately, but we leave it to projection to move it into its final destination. This ends up breaking the native projection, because the slots have to be in place from the beginning. The following changes switch to appending the element immediately when inside a component with Shadow DOM encapsulation.

This PR resolves FW-841.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): content projection with Shadow DOM not working" (#28261)

Issues.Body:

Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [X] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [X] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Calling `player.setPosition(value)` before `player.play()` causes an error "undefined is not an object" [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-getposition-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts)
Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
calling `setPosition` before `play` will set the position without playing the animation. Calling `setPosition` after `play` will behave as before (set the position, and play the animation starting from the new position)

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No

## Other information
To prevent problems like this, maybe `domPlayer` should either become nullable, or have a getter that checks for undefined.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): View Queries inheritance fix
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change `viewQuery` functions that represent @ViewQuery list were not composable, which caused problems in case one Component/Directive inherits another one and both of them have View Queries. Due to the fact that we used indices to reference queries, resulting query set was corrupted (child component queries were overridden by super class ones). In order to avoid that we no longer use indices assigned at compile time and instead maintain current view query index while iterating through them. This allows us to compose `viewQuery` functions and make inheritance feature work with View Queries.

Note: Content Queries have similar issue and it will be resolved within the upcoming PR.

This PR resolves FW-829.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): View Queries inheritance fix" (#28249)

Issues.Title: Better error reporting / exceptions when importing lazy loaded modules
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

- @angular/router
- @angular/core

### Description
Detect when a lazy loaded module is being imported elsewhere (By mistake - in other word not only in the router path via `loadChildren`).  I think the "Confusion" around the following two issues stemmed from me accidentally importing a lazy loaded module into the main module.  [I wrote an article about it here.](https://medium.com/@ole.ersoy/angular-module-lazy-load-gotcha-9852d628257)  Something that is easy to do given the steep angular learning curve.

- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27918
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27920

### Describe the solution you'd like
If a lazy load module is imported anywhere except via the router path, throw an exception.  If this works well on stackblitz that would be a big plus.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
As can be seen in this SO issue imports of lazy loaded modules causes errors that it's easy to miss read.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54030737/adding-id-to-guarded-component-path-causes-infinite-loop

I had several  other SO posts WRT this and it took a long time before someone diagnosed the import issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Better error reporting / exceptions when importing lazy loaded modules" (#28248)

Issues.Title: Using "title" as a component input
Issues.Body: To be clear, this is not a bug. However, I have noticed that if I use an input called "title" for a component, when the user hovers over this component in the DOM, the value of the "title" input appears next to the cursor. I realize this is because [title] is a valid HTML attribute, however, it would be nice to be able to use this as the name of an input without experiencing this functionality. Not sure if this is even possible, just pointing it out at this point in the hopes that someone reads this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using "title" as a component input" (#28247)

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): wip: provide support for map-based host bindings for [style] and [class]
Issues.Body:
Up until now, `[style]` and `[class]` bindings (the map-based ones) have only
worked as template bindings and have not been supported at all inside of host
bindings. This patch ensures that multiple host binding sources (components and
directives) all properly assign style values and merge them correctly in terms
of priority.

Issues.Title: CODEOWNERS global approvers plan
Issues.Body:
# Problem

`CODEOWNERS` maps each file to a group of approvers. Unfortunately, it can only have one group allowed per file - we cannot have groups of "global approvers" with the ability to approve changes across larger parts of the project.

We would like this capability as otherwise the review burden on large changes is too great. We cannot add individual users to every group as this creates review spam.

# Proposal

We already have a bot that monitors PR labels, posts PR statuses, etc. We will add this bot's user to every approval group in `CODEOWNERS`, making it a _de facto_ global approver.

The bot will be programmed with a configuration of global approvers and a list of review groups (e.g. `fw-core`) for which they are considered as global approvers.

For each PR, the bot will take action when all of the subsequent conditions are met:

1) A configured global approver (e.g. @kara) has approved the PR.

2) The same configured global approver has added the `PR state: global approval` label.

3) The PR has all _other_ approvals it needs (those not covered by the global approver(s).

When all 3 of these conditions are met, the bot itself will approve the PR. Because of its status as an approver for every group, this will enable the PR to merge.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CODEOWNERS global approvers plan" (#28245)

Issues.Title: ng add options, other than --help, are not supported
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [x] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The ng add command does not support listed options, other than '--help'. V6 of the CLI didn't support any options, beyond help, with add. After a little investigation into the code, it appears the add.json schema was updated to utilize the schematic definitions from definitions.json but it doesn't appear that add-impl.ts was fully updated to support them. From what I can tell, with my limited exploration into the code, add-impl.ts has hard-coded values for dryRun and force within the defined "runOptions" object. I am currently unaware of a package that utilizes interactive prompts so I could not validate if the defaults or interactive options are working or not but I do not see any additional interrogation of options object to look for them either. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ng new my-app --defaults cd my-app ng add --help ng add @angular/pwa --dry-run Since this package performs modifications, I would have expected to see a listing of those changes with the typical "dryRun" message. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: No warning given when using ES2017
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Zone.js does not support native async/await (https://github.com/angular/zone.js/pull/1140) as present in ES2017. This means code that happens inside async/await blocks is invisible to zone.js thus not triggering change detection. Since this is a footgun for developer, Angular CLI should show a warning about this when ES2017 is set as the typescript target. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/angular/zone.js/pull/1140 ## üî• Exception or Error No error, just no change detection. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Build-optimizer fixes for FESM/ESM bundles
Issues.Body:
fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): prefix renamed classes
Module concatenation may rename classes with the same name. The renaming logic is specific to the bundler so we can't really foresee it.

But the fact remains that the inner function declaration doesn't need to have the same name as the outer one.

---

fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): identify relative imports in angular core

Build optimizer was broken for non-FESM files inside @angular/core because it couldn't identify relative imports were still inside core.

This change adds a known list of angular core files as a default, and also allows passing in a override.

Would be nice if would be possible to select which unit test framework will be used in the project. Many developers use for instance `Jest` also for Angular applications.

Issues.Title: [mat-icon] preventing content from translation
Issues.Body:
Current behavior: 

before translation | after translation
:---:|:---:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51412407-8bfcb580-1b7c-11e9-8d4c-9f1204b556b7.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51412741-aaaf7c00-1b7d-11e9-9921-060f8e28a337.png)

to prevent `mat-icon` content from translation by automated tools I'm adding `notranslate` class to `mat-icon` by default.

PS: I think it makes sense to use this class all the time and not only for font icons since even for svg icons there are only the following use cases:

1.  There is no text inside svg icon - so class will do no harm
2.  There is some text (e.g. one big letter as an icon) and it most likely shouldn't be translated
3.  It is highly unlikely to have a long text inside svg icon and to want it to be translated

This why I decided to have less conditions and add class to all icons by default.

From [Google Translate FAQ](https://cloud.google.com/translate/faq):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24639631/51423871-50430980-1bd7-11e9-9705-42ea24307b0f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[mat-icon] preventing content from translation" (#14889)

Issues.Title: The components used in the dialogues should be more reusable
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
The idea would be for the component to be independent of whether or not it is a dialogue, using the same elements as always (@Input, @Output)

To open the dialog, it would only be necessary to call it by passing these inputs and output, instead of injecting the data, something that only works using the dialog service. Remaining the unusable component from outside a dialogue.

For this I propose that the dialogue be implemented in the html, and the service only show or hide it:

Something similar to:

<button (click) = "dialog1.open ()"> Open dialog </ button>

<mat-dialog # dialog1>
¬†¬†¬†¬†<component1 testInput = "test" />
</ mat-dialog>

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Reusability of the components created for the dialogues.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
If this option is not implemented, the dialogues take more work, and breaks the NRY (Not Repeat Yourself) principle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The components used in the dialogues should be more reusable" (#14882)

Issues.Title: triggering a dialog from a menu item doesn't focus dialog properly
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
The element in the dialog that has the `cdkFocusInitial` directive should gain focus when the dialog opens. This is also how it worked as of angular/material2 5, but broke in 6.

#### What is the current behavior?
Focus returns to the menu trigger button (now hidden behind the dialog's backdrop, so not that helpful).

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
broken with angular 6: https://stackblitz.com/edit/checkbox-reactive-2zhjpp
working with angular 5: https://stackblitz.com/edit/checkbox-reactive-soumtp

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
See above -- this is a regression.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
angular 5+material 5 work fine, angular 6 + material 6 are broken (that's as far as I backtraced it)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
there were noticeable changes in the interim timeframe to https://github.com/angular/material2/blame/246320032404e912461bf8c39b65d6d2b92646ca/src/cdk/a11y/focus-monitor/focus-monitor.ts#L245 (which is what's called to focus the trigger)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "triggering a dialog from a menu item doesn't focus dialog properly" (#14879)
